previewArticle.title: Brazil vs. Mexico: 2014 FIFA World Cup | Group A Match Preview

recapArticle.title: Brazil 0, Mexico 0: 2014 FIFA World Cup | Group A Match Recap

timelineItems.comment: First Half begins.
Neymar (Brazil) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by José Juan Vázquez (Mexico).
Ramires (Brazil) wins a free kick on the right wing.
Foul by Andrés Guardado (Mexico).

timelineItems.name: Alchemist
timelineItems.text: Paulinho has alot of athleticism in him #BRAvMEX #2014FIFAWorldCup

timelineItems.name: Andy.l.71.
timelineItems.text: "Marcello in space" Jonathon Pearce's commentary from the Moon.#BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Luke Asa Guidici
timelineItems.text: is this the summer olympics? #diving #BRAvMEX #WorldCup

timelineItems.name: Raymundo Jeiyol
timelineItems.text: This match is so electrifying #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Hand ball by Oribe Peralta (Mexico).

timelineItems.name: Church of Soccer
timelineItems.text: Old Man Alves isn’t as fast as he was 5 days ago…when his hair wasn’t gray. #BRAvMEX #WorldCup

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Brazil. Oscar tries a through ball, but Fred is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: George Ploumidis
timelineItems.text: Dani Alves looks like the live child of Leo Di Caprio and Flea. #blondeywhitetipsinhairlooksterrible #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Bowyay
timelineItems.text: good moves by Brasil, putting on the pressure early, not unexpected, especially against a team as fiery as Mexico #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Andrés Guardado (Mexico) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Dani Alves (Brazil).

timelineItems.name: Matthew Baines
timelineItems.text: Still waiting for the Brazilian fans to start singing "It's just like watching Barnsley" #bravmex

timelineItems.name: Still Dre
timelineItems.text: Oscar getting his grown man on right now. #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Bowyay
timelineItems.text: on a side note: Fred, still useless #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Buggy
timelineItems.text: Hurry up and score Brazil, the referee is doing his part! #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Lee Powers
timelineItems.text: I actually don't mind this referee being not too strict on yellow cards. Makes a nice chance #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Shaun Manning
timelineItems.text: Man, some aggressive football... #BRAvMEX #worldcup

timelineItems.name: Matt Oswin
timelineItems.text: Fred went down in the penalty area - surely a pen! #WorldCup #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Paul Aguilar (Mexico).
Oscar (Brazil) wins a free kick on the left wing.
Attempt blocked. Fred (Brazil) left footed shot from the centre of the box is blocked. Assisted by Neymar.

timelineItems.name: Mary DeMarco Young
timelineItems.text: Dani Alves doing what he does: hard fouls. Should have been yellow carded. #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Foul by David Luiz (Brazil).
Giovani dos Santos (Mexico) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Chris Giles
timelineItems.text: From what I've seen there's little doubt that the refs are under instruction to be lenient with bookings. Pundits haven't noticed? #BravMex

timelineItems.name: Rahul Puri
timelineItems.text: I see Mexico has decided to park the bus. Brazil though labouring in attack. #BravMex

timelineItems.name: bV
timelineItems.text: If there was no ball involved, eight people would've already gotten arrested for assault. #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Francisco Javier Rodríguez (Mexico).
Neymar (Brazil) wins a free kick on the left wing.

timelineItems.name: Riley Marcus
timelineItems.text: Loving this game so far. Amazing skill. #BRAvMEX #BRAvsMEX #WorldCup2014 #WorldCup

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Luiz Gustavo (Brazil) left footed shot from outside the box misses to the left. Assisted by Dani Alves.

timelineItems.name: Peter Smith
timelineItems.text: Garrincha, Pele, Jairzinho, Tostao, Gerson, Rivelino, Socrates, Zico, Ronaldo, Ronaldinho..............Fred. #BravMex #WorldCup2014

timelineItems.name: Kimberly Frederick
timelineItems.text: The power keeps going in and off. It's really pissing me off, especially since I'm trying to watch #BRAvMEX #WorldCup

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Brazil. Marcelo tries a through ball, but Fred is caught offside.
Foul by Paulinho (Brazil).
Andrés Guardado (Mexico) wins a free kick on the left wing.

timelineItems.name: Rocco Deserto
timelineItems.text: Neymar going the 1998 route with the frosted hair. #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Futbol Costa Rica
timelineItems.text: Cuneyt Cakir de Turquía es el central, ficha por el diálogo en un partido que ha sido de roce. 20’ #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Evan Ream
timelineItems.text: What are the odds that Rafa Marquez is on the field at the end of this game? 20%? 10%? #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Claudia Perez
timelineItems.text: Great to watch a Mexico game narrated by Perro Bermudez. Makes me feel I am in Mexico. #worldcup #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Bowyay
timelineItems.text: is Fred ever onside? #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Match ends, Brazil 0, Mexico 0.

timelineItems.name: Paul Carr
timelineItems.text: Today's #WorldCup coverage: AUS-NED: 11:30 AM ET, ESPN ESP-CHI, 2:30 ET, ESPN CMR-CRO, 5:30 ET, ESPN

timelineItems.name: OptaJoe
timelineItems.text: 7 - Arjen Robben has scored seven goals in his last seven appearances for #NED. Threat. #WorldCup

timelineItems.name: OptaJoe
timelineItems.text: 11 - #NED are unbeaten in their last 11 #WorldCup group stage matches, winning eight and drawing three. Juggernaut.

timelineItems.name: Paul Carr
timelineItems.text: Tim Cahill has five career #WorldCup goals. All other Australians have a total of five.

timelineItems.name: Paul Carr
timelineItems.text: 49 goals so far at the World Cup, most through 17 #WorldCup games since 1958.

timelineItems.name: Paul Carr
timelineItems.text: Arjen Robben now has six career #WorldCup goals. Johnny Rep is the only Dutchman with more (7).

timelineItems.name: Paul Carr
timelineItems.text: Busy #WorldCup day ahead: Netherlands & Chile could advance. Spain (!) is 1 of 4 teams that could be eliminated.

timelineItems.name: Zach Younglove
timelineItems.text: Neymar getting straight up dirty on that left side. Soon.... #WorldCup #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Shaneeza Aziz
timelineItems.text: i think the ref kind of realizes yellow cards will not stop the number of fouls that will be committed in #BRAvMEX #WorldCup2014

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Brazil. Dani Alves tries a through ball, but Fred is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Irish Eyes Bet
timelineItems.text: The diving - Judges so far score it 7.8 8.5 9.0 #BravMex #WorldCup

timelineItems.name: JJ
timelineItems.text: Does Fred actually know what off side is ? #Brazil2014 #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Michael Hadley
timelineItems.text: The refs aren't taking any crap from Brasil or Mexico today. No ones getting any acting awards today #BRAvMEX #WorldCup

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Héctor Herrera (Mexico) right footed shot from outside the box is just a bit too high. Assisted by Oribe Peralta.

timelineItems.name: Zach Younglove
timelineItems.text: If Fred gets caught offsides one mo' time.... #WorldCup #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Darryl Dioso
timelineItems.text: Both teams, I just want to yell "Get up!". This game has no flow at all. #BRAvMEX #WorldCup2014

timelineItems.name: Bowyay
timelineItems.text: ooh Mexico, almost making the most of their few chances so far, good countering, they need a little more though #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Dåñïêł Ēšpìńāł
timelineItems.text: Coming home to watch the World Cup is so awesome #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Carl Rose
timelineItems.text: Wow the atmosphere coming from that stadium is insane! #BRAvMEX #WorldCup2014

timelineItems.name: Bowyay
timelineItems.text: good comment from the commentator there, Mexico have the confidence now, getting a bit of rhythm/flow to their game #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Miguel Layún (Mexico) right footed shot from more than 35 yards is too high.
Attempt saved. Neymar (Brazil) header from the centre of the box is saved in the bottom left corner. Assisted by Dani Alves with a cross.

timelineItems.name: Scott Waldman
timelineItems.text: Memo Ochoa saves and Rafa clears. Its 2008 all over again. #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Sai kiruba
timelineItems.text: That hand of the Mexican keeper came out of nowhere #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Andy Gillooley
timelineItems.text: That save looks better every time I see it! Outstanding! Another World Cup moment! #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Erik
timelineItems.text: Dueling keepers here. Pretty fun match so far. #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Ike Edeani
timelineItems.text: That play, right there, is why football is the greatest sport. #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: Robert Hawley
timelineItems.text: Both teams playing with the freedom of having won their first game. Really entertaining #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Oscar (Brazil) right footed shot from outside the box is saved in the bottom left corner. Assisted by Paulinho.

timelineItems.name: Juancarlos Escalante
timelineItems.text: Gah! I don't like those red visitor kits that #Mexico has on. Looks like a traffic light out there with the green shirted ref #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: duffle
timelineItems.text: David Luiz's hair is so majestic #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Mexico. Conceded by Thiago Silva.

timelineItems.name: Ziyaad LFC
timelineItems.text: Brazillian fans now copying Mexico fans chant at every goal-kick... PUTO! #BRAvMEX

timelineItems.name: kirk smith
timelineItems.text: #WorldCup2014 @BBCSport This is how World Cup games should be played... #BRAvMEX every player giving everything for there country..

timelineItems.name: kcconejito
timelineItems.text: If anyone wants to know how a 0-0 draw can be exciting, turn in the #BRAvMEX match.

timelineItems.name: Janet Garcia
timelineItems.text: Soccer be takin years off my life #BRAvMEX #WorldCup

timelineItems.text: #bravmex i love the World Cup so much atmospere at this game. I wish I was Brazilian (a rich one of course)
